intro: Beckmannia hirsutiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered beckmannia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its wiry, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with hairy bracts, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive texture. Beckmannia hirsutiflora is typically found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and mountainous regions.
